Green Wedding Decor: Use recycled materials to create unique and eco-friendly decorations for the wedding ceremony and reception. This could include using old books as table runners, turning old maps into wall art, and creating centerpieces from recycled glass bottles. Confidence Score: 0.8/1

Sustainable Wedding Attire: Encourage guests to wear sustainable and eco-friendly clothing to the wedding by providing a "green dress code" on the invitations. This could also include offering a "rental" service for wedding dresses and suits, rather than having guests purchase new, unsustainable attire. Confidence Score: 0.9/1

Eco-Friendly Food and Beverage: Offer a vegetarian or vegan menu for the wedding, and source ingredients from local, organic farms. Additionally, provide reusable water bottles and encourage guests to bring their own reusable utensils and plates to reduce waste. Confidence Score: 0.9/1

Carbon Offset Wedding: Calculate the carbon footprint of the wedding and offset it by investing in renewable energy projects or reforestation efforts. This could also include offering carbon offset options for guests to purchase, and donating any remaining funds to an eco-friendly charity. Confidence Score: 0.8/1

Eco-Friendly Transportation: Provide transportation options for guests that are eco-friendly, such as shuttle buses or carpooling services. This could also include offering electric or hybrid vehicles for guests to use during the wedding and reception. Confidence Score: 0.9/1
